title: Orion

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of linen, wool, and horsehair, slit and double interlocking tapestry weave with eccentric wefts and supplementary wrapping wefts forming cut pile; backing bands of jute, plain weave.

artist_display:
Ásgerdur Ester Búadóttir (Icelandic, Dec. 4, 1920-May 19, 2014)
Reykjavik, Iceland
medium_display: Linen, wool, and horsehair, slit and double interlocking tapestry weave with eccentric wefts and supplementary wrapping wefts forming cut pile; backing bands of jute, plain weave
inscriptions:
Handwritten on reverse: Ásgerdur Búadóttir 81

Printed on tag on reverse:
Utställningen Borealis
Asgerdur Buadottir: Orion
Nordiskt Konstcentrum
Sveaborg
00190 Helsingfors 19
Finland

Handwritten on tag: K22
credit_line: Gift of Nancy and Robert D. Barton
publication_history:
Nutida Nordisk Konst [Contemporary Nordic Art] (Stockholm: Galerie Plaisiren in collaboration with Nordiskt Kulturcentrum, 1982), cat. 81 (ill.).

Sune Nordgren, Borealis: Pohjoismaisia Kuvia/Nordisk Bild/Nordic Image, exh. cat. (Helsinki: Pohjoismainen Taidekeskus, 1983), cat. no. 3 (not ill.).

Aðalsteinn Ingólfsson, Ásgerdur Búadóttir, exh. cat. (Reykjavik: Kjarvalsstadir Art Museum, 1984), cat. 7 (not ill.).

Robert D. Barton, Color & Form: International Innovations in Textiles, exh. cat. (Washington, DC: Fine Arts Program of the Federal Reserve Board with the Textiles Arts Foundation), cat. 3 (ill).
exhibition_history:
Stockholm, Galerie Plaisiren, Hässelby Castle in collaboration with Nordiskt Kulturcentrum, Nutida Nordisk Konst [Contemporary Nordic Art], Feb. 20-Apr. 4, 1982, cat.

Helsinki, Finland, Borealis: Pohjoismaisia Kuvia/Nordisk Bild/Nordic Image, Nordic Arts Center, Mar. 1983, cat.

Reykjavik, Iceland, Kjarvalsstadir Art Museum, Ásgerdur Búadóttir, Nov. 1984, cat.

Washington, DC, Federal Reserve Board Building, Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System in cooperation with the Textile Art Foundation, Color & Form: International Innovations in Textiles, Apr. 3-May 25, 1990, cat.

Boston, MA, Federal Reserve Bank Gallery in cooperation with the Textile Arts Foundation, Textiles from Around the World, May 6-June 21, 1991.

Art Institute of Chicago, Elizabeth F. Cheney and Agnes Allerton Textile Galleries, The 20th-Century Textile Artist, Mar. 31–Aug. 1, 1999.

Art Institute of Chicago, Elizabeth F. Cheney and Agnes Allerton Textile Galleries, Contemporary Fiber Art, A Selection from the Permanent Collection, Nov. 3, 2010-May 8, 2011.
provenance_text: Nancy Hemenway Barton and Robert D. Barton [Textile Arts Foundation], West Boothbay Harbor and West Southport, ME, by 1984 [Aðalsteinn Ingólfsson, 1984; incoming permanent receipt RX2132, Sept. 4, 1996; copy in curatorial object file]; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1996.
